title: Monitoring GDAC content
text: The Argo GDAC content monitoring is updated once a week.

title: Monitoring GDAC content
text:
Active floats
An Argo float is active if it has transmitted data within the last 30 days.
The counting is done by DAC (Data Assembly Center). There are 11 DACs worldwide that process Argo float data and distribute it to the GDAC (Global Data Assembly Centre).

title: Monitoring GDAC content
text:
All floats
Number of floats per DAC, deployed from 1997 to date.

title: Monitoring GDAC content
text:
Histogram of vertical profiles
Annual distribution of vertical profiles carried out by Argo floats. A vertical profile is a measurement of temperature and salinity at different depths in the ocean, down to 2000 meters or more. Some floats measure additional parameters such as oxygen, chlorophyll, pH, nitrate, and optics.

title: Monitoring GDAC content
text:
Histogram of profiles percent
Identical to the previous graph, but in percentages by year and DACs.

title: Monitoring GDAC content
text:
Histogram of data modes
Argo float vertical profiles are processed and distributed by the DACs in real-time mode (within a few hours), then in delayed-mode (within a few months) by their scientific lead (PI - Principal Investigator).

title: Monitoring GDAC content
text:
Histogram of data modes percent
Identical to the previous graph, but in percentages.

title: Monitoring GDAC content
section: The last 12 months map from Argo index file
text:
The last 12 months map from Argo index file
This animated map clearly illustrates the global coverage of the Argo observation network. The floats are colored by DAC. Click on “full screen” for a better visualization.

title: Monitoring GDAC content
text:
More on Argo floats dashboard
https://fleetmonitoring.euro-argo.eu

title: GDAC June updates: kiost and argo_sensor_exclusion_list.txt
text:
Three changes regarding the Argo GDAC were scheduled for Monday, June 30, 2025.

Renaming the Korean DAC KORDI to KIOST (with no impact on NetCDF file content)
Removing the Argo GDAC greylist (no more public access)
Restricting access to the argo_sensor_exclusion_list.txt (which replaces the greylist) to on-demand access (by request to sismer@ifremer.fr).

This update was finalized on June 30, 2025, at 12:10 UTC.

title: Argo user’s manual version 3.43.0
text:
The major version 3.43.0 of “Argo user’s manual” was published on June 23rd 2025. It is available on https://dx.doi.org/10.13155/29825
There are 19 changes:

Throughout the document: added links to individual Reference tables in the NVS
§2.2.1 optional global attribute “id” contains “Argo GDAC DOI”. Argo GDAC data DOI global attribute is optional and recommended https://github.com/nvs-vocabs/ArgoVocabs/issues/43 and https://github.com/OneArgo/ADMT/issues/72
§2.2.4 §2.3.4 §2.4.4 PI_NAME has a controlled vocabulary https://github.com/OneArgo/ArgoVocabs/issues/6
§2.4.7.1 SENSOR_FIRMWARE_VERSION https://github.com/OneArgo/ArgoVocabs/issues/55
§2.4.5 deployment_platform dimension extended to string128 https://github.com/OneArgo/ArgoVocabs/issues/2#issuecomment-2437421119
§2.2.4 §2.3.4 §2.4.4 PROJECT_NAME comment revision
§2.4.4 add PROGRAM_NAME variable https://github.com/OneArgo/ArgoVocabs/issues/5
§2.4.4 PROJECT_NAME long_name changed
§2.4.7.1 SENSOR_MODEL comment clarification: the new definition of SENSOR_MODEL is “as defined by the sensor manufacturer” (reference table R27) https://github.com/OneArgo/ArgoVocabs/issues/55
§3.22 … §3.28: remove the remaining tyinurl
§3.1 add “Argo auxiliary meta-data” data type
§3.2.1: add a comment to provide examples when *_qc= ’ ’ can occur as per https://github.com/OneArgo/ArgoVocabs/issues/21
§3.3. remove the sentence about FillValue = 99999.f. The FillValue of various parameters are now specified in R03.
§3.3.1 How to indicate multiple sensors for the same parameter https://github.com/OneArgo/ArgoVocabs/issues/81
§3.11 change from grey list to supplemental sensor exclusion list in reference table 11 (example) https://github.com/OneArgo/ADMT/discussions/70
§3.33 add PI_NAME reference table
§4.1.2.2. Under File Naming Convention, change the filename prefix of the synthetic files from “M” to “S”.
§6.2 remove greylist paragraph https://github.com/OneArgo/ADMT/discussions/70
§6.2 “Grey list” removed: the greylist management is internal, documented in the Quality control manual.

Note: the version 3.42.0 was published in May 2025, but not advertised. The 19 changes are from both the 3.42.0 and 3.43.0 versions. See the details in page 12 of the manual.

title: Documentation: 4 lists now managed in NVS vocabulary server
text:
These 4 documents have been removed from the “Documentation” page. They are now available in the NVS vocabulary server, which is a more suitable place for such documents.

Argo physical parameters list: core-Argo and BGC-Argo R03
Technical parameters names R14
Configuration parameter names, core-Argo R18
Configuration parameter names, BGC-Argo R18

title: BGC-Argo configuration parameter names December 2024 release
text:
On December 19th 2024, Catherine Schmechtig distributed an update of BGC-Argo configuration parameter names.
This update is available on Documentation
A secondary optode sensor on a stick is accepted.

title: Documentation
text:
How is Argo data management organized ?

A beginners’ guide to accessing Argo data
Argo data FAQ



Argo data formats

The Argo data formats are described in the “Argo user’s manual” https://dx.doi.org/10.13155/29825
Reference tables master documents

R03 - Argo parameters core & bgc
R14 - Technical parameters names
R18 - Configuration parameter names, core-Argo
R18 - Configuration parameter names, bgc-Argo

User manual for technical files

Technical parameters naming convention rules
Technical and configuration parameters units
Surface pressure correction table




Quality control

Argo quality control manual for CTD and trajectory data https://dx.doi.org/10.13155/33951
Argo quality control manual for dissolved oxygen concentration https://doi.org/10.13155/46542
BGC-Argo quality control manual for biogeochemical data https://dx.doi.org/10.13155/40879
BGC-Argo quality control manual for chlorophyll-A concentration https://dx.doi.org/10.13155/35385
BGC-Argo quality control manual for nitrate concentration https://doi.org/10.13155/84370
BGC-Argo quality control for radiometry https://doi.org/10.13155/62466
BGC-Argo quality control manual for pH https://doi.org/10.13155/97828
BGC Argo quality control manual for particles backscattering https://doi.org/10.13155/60262



Cookbooks, Core-Argo

Argo DAC profile cookbook https://dx.doi.org/10.13155/41151
Argo DAC trajectory cookbook https://dx.doi.org/10.13155/29824
Common method for determining position and Time and attribute the appropriate QC
Core-Argo DMQC cookbook https://doi.org/10.13155/78994



Cookbooks, BGC-Argo

Processing Argo oxygen data at the DAC level cookbook https://doi.org/10.13155/39795
BGC-Argo processing particle backscattering at the DAC level https://dx.doi.org/10.13155/39459
BGC-Argo processing chlorophyll-A concentration at the DAC level https://dx.doi.org/10.13155/39468
BGC-Argo processing Argo measurement timing information at the DAC level https://dx.doi.org/10.13155/47998
Processing BGC-Argo CDOM concentration at the DAC level https://doi.org/10.13155/54541
Processing Bio-Argo nitrate concentration at the DAC Level https://dx.doi.org/10.13155/46121
Processing BGC-Argo Radiometric data at the DAC level https://doi.org/10.13155/51541
Processing BGC-Argo pH data at the DAC level https://doi.org/10.13155/57195



Cookbooks, GDAC

Description of the Argo GDAC File Checks: Data Format and Consistency Checks https://dx.doi.org/10.13155/46120
BGC-Argo synthetic profile file processing and format on Coriolis GDAC https://doi.org/10.13155/55637
Argo GDAC cookbook https://doi.org/10.13155/46202

title: Argo user’s manual v3.42.0 release
text:
Here is the version 3.42.0 of Argo user’s manual https://dx.doi.org/10.13155/29825
It includes 12 changes:

§2.2.1 optional global attribute “id” contains “Argo GDAC DOI” Argo GDAC data DOI global attribute is optional and recommended https://github.com/nvs-vocabs/ArgoVocabs/issues/43 and https://github.com/OneArgo/ADMT/issues/72
Throughout the document: added links to individual Reference tables in the NVS
§2.2.4 §2.3.4 §2.4.4 PI_NAME has a controlled vocabulary https://github.com/OneArgo/ArgoVocabs/issues/6
§2.4.7.1.1 Float sensor status within Argo program https://github.com/OneArgo/ArgoVocabs/issues/76
§2.4.7.1 SENSOR_FIRMWARE_VERSION https://github.com/OneArgo/ArgoVocabs/issues/55
§2.4.5 deployment_platform dimension extended to string128 https://github.com/OneArgo/ArgoVocabs/issues/2#issuecomment-2437421119
§3.1 add “Argo auxiliary meta-data” data type
§3.2.1: add a comment to provide examples when *_qc= ‘ ‘ can occur as per https://github.com/OneArgo/ArgoVocabs/issues/21
§3.22 … §3.28: remove the remaining tyinurl
§3.11 change from grey list to supplemental sensor exclusion list in reference table 11 https://github.com/OneArgo/ADMT/discussions/70
§3.33 add PI_NAME reference table
§6.2 remove greylist paragraph, the sensor exclusion list (greylist) management is internal, documented in the Quality control manual. https://github.com/OneArgo/ADMT/discussions/70

title: Argo NetCDF file format checker updated
text:
The Argo NetCDF files format checker was updated on June 18, 2025.
More information on https://github.com/OneArgo/ArgoFormatChecker/releases/tag/v2.9.0
An additional minor correction was applied on June 19th 2025.

title: Coriolis GDAC FTP Connection Issue
text:
The FTP connection to the server ftp.ifremer.fr is blocked today, Monday, June 23rd.
As a result, GDAC Coriolis is unable to download files from the various DACs. We’ll let you know once the situation returns to normal.
Synchronization with GDAC-US will allow GDAC Coriolis to stay up-to-date, but with a delay of several hours.
We apologize for this service degradation.

title: Coriolis GDAC FTP Connection Issue
text:
The FTP connection to the server ftp.ifremer.fr is blocked today, Monday, June 23rd.
As a result, GDAC Coriolis is unable to download files from the various DACs. We’ll let you know once the situation returns to normal.
Synchronization with GDAC-US will allow GDAC Coriolis to stay up-to-date, but with a delay of several hours.
We apologize for this service degradation.

title: Coriolis GDAC FTP Connection Issue
text:
Conclusion
The connection issue with the ftp.ifremer.fr server was resolved on Wednesday, June 25, around 1:00 PM.
It was ultimately limited to FTP downloads of Argo data for GDAC users. Contrary to what was initially reported, the FTP upload of data by Argo DACs to the GDAC was not affected.
